item.title: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

i just need a reference or something, taharok, the one you gave me that was like notepad got my text… but i cant seem to find the difference… ill examin it more.

item.title: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I don’t see what the big fuss is about. javax.swing.JTextField.getText() does return a string with the text from the field inside of it.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

the 2 ")'s was an accident but it didnt effect it. But now i get the same thing i was showing pwnd

you wrote: javax.swing.JTextArea[,0,0,0x0,invalid,layout=javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTextUI$UpdateHandler,alignmentX=0.0,alignmentY=0.0,border=javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicBorders$MarginBorder@18a47e0,flags=296,maximumSize=,minimumSize=,preferredSize=,caretColor=sun.swing.PrintColorUIResource[r=51,g=51,b=51],disabledTextColor=javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource[r=184,g=207,b=229],editable=true,margin=javax.swing.plaf.InsetsUIResource[top=0,left=0,bottom=0,right=0],selectedTextColor=sun.swing.PrintColorUIResource[r=51,g=51,b=51],selectionColor=javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource[r=184,g=207,b=229],colums=7,columWidth=0,rows=0,rowHeight=0,word=false,wrap=false], thats what you wrote

item.title: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote=“Gotta Catch Them All, post:15, topic:114990”][quote author=Frell link=topic=164184.msg1535064#msg1535064 date=1182589471]
ill post my code. You show me what i need.

heres my text area

TextArea name1 = new JTextArea(0,7);

heres my whole writer thingy

PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("Command.txt")))); //write the file	         
	         out.write("You wrote: "+name1.getText()+", thats what you wrote")");	         
	         out.close();

[/quote]

Stop the hijack and read some tutorials. Seriously.[/quote]

what frell is doing is perfectly fine because tutorials dont teach you anything

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:114990”]ill post my code. You show me what i need.

heres my text area

TextArea name1 = new JTextArea(0,7);

heres my whole writer thingy

PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("Command.txt")))); //write the file out.write("You wrote: "+name1.getText()+", thats what you wrote")"); out.close(); [/quote]

instead of having this

out.write("You wrote: "+name1.getText()+", thats what you wrote")");

why dont you try this

String variabeName = name1.getText(); out.write("You wrote: " + variableName + ", thats what you wrote")");

and why do you have this at the end?

")")

if this doesnt work post the error and ill try to fix it (you could also try jtextfield)

Read full topic

item.source: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?

item.title: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:9, topic:114990”]ok you know that reference you gave me when i needed to make files with txt etc. in them, well. I compared mine to yours and my txt area is called name1, so i put

out.write(“text”+ name1.getText() +“text”);

but it wont get the text.

also, were exactly would i add this? javax.swing.JTextField.getText() it looks like something you import[/quote]
name your class like this:

public class classname extends javax.swing.JFrame {

then what you would do is this:

String anything = name.getText();

name is the name of the text field that is assigned when you do this:

name = new javax.swing.JTextField(); //declares name as an instance of a text field for anyone who didn't know[/code]

so you can write this:

[code]String anything = name.getText();[/code]

or this:

[code]String anything = javax.swing.name.getText()

where ever you want

(sorry if i got too in depth, i try to be as detailed as possible in case there is any noob reading this, im trying to be helpful)

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get the string from a jtextfield?

but it wont get the text.

also, were exactly would i add this? javax.swing.JTextField.getText() it looks like something you import

It returns a string with the current text which is inside of the JTextField
